message.content:
cs.CR, cs.IT, cs.CY, cs.SE, cs.HC

The paper discusses physical unclonable functions (PUFs) as hardware security primitives and their use in lightweight authentication. This topic falls under the category of computer security and cryptography, which is covered by cs.CR. The paper also discusses obfuscation techniques, which are related to information theory (cs.IT) and cybersecurity (cs.CY). The study of authentication mechanisms and their reliability falls under software engineering (cs.SE), and the paper also discusses the usability of the proposed technique, which is related to human-computer interaction (cs.HC).
